page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: WHEN WE MADE A STUDY OF THE TYPES OF TRANSPORT IN OUR AREA WE DISCOVERED THAT NEARLY EVERY FAMILY HAD A CAR. THERE WERE SOME PEOPLE, MOSTLY THE ELDERLY WHO HAD TO RELY ENTIRELY ON PUBLIC TRANSPORT. IT DID NOT SURPRISE US THAT THERE WERE SO MANY CARS BECAUSE THE AREA IS SO ISOLATED AND PEOPLE NEED A FORM OF TRANSPORT TO GO SHOPPING OR FIND ENTERTAINMENT AND THE PUBLIC BUS SERVICE ONLY GOES THROUGH OUR AREA ONCE A WEEK. WE DID A TRAFFIC COUNT ON THE COUNTRY ROAD NEAR OUR SCHOOL AND FOUND THAT DURING A SIX HOUR PERIOD FROM 9 A.M. TO 3 P.M. THERE WERE ONLY 47 CARS, 6 LORRIES, 4 MOTOR BIKES AND 9 BIKES. ON THE ONE MAIN ROAD THAT GOES THROUGH OUR BLOCK THERE IS MUCH MORE TRAFFIC BECAUSE IT LEADS TO THE M3 MOTORWAY ABOUT 3 MILES AWAY.
